H0.text: who did gerald ford select as his vice president when he became president. George H.W. Bush

H1.text: who did gerald ford select as his vice president when he became president. Bob Dole

H2.text: who did gerald ford select as his vice president when he became president. Howard Baker

H3.text: who did gerald ford select as his vice president when he became president. Nelson Rockefeller

A4.text: Upon President Nixon's resignation on August 9, 1974, Vice President Gerald Ford assumed the presidency. On August 20, Ford nominated Rockefeller to be the next vice president of the United States.

A5.text: Rockefeller was appointed vice president of the United States by President Gerald Ford in December 1974.
